author: Doha Madani
title: Lay's Classic Potato Chips recalled over 'life-threatening' allergy risk
text:
Lay's Classic Potato Chips recalled over 'life-threatening' allergy risk Doha Madani Updated Fri, December 20, 2024 at 12:03 AM UTC 1 min read
Lay's classic potato chips. Frito-Lay recalled one of its most popular potato chip products because of milk that was not declared on the label, according to the Food and Drug Administration .
Lay's Classic Potato Chips, which shoppers may recognize for its familiar fluorescent yellow bag, are being recalled in Oregon and Washington, the FDA said Wednesday. It's unclear where there was contamination with milk, as the chips' listed ingredients are potatoes, vegetable oil and salt.
"Those with an allergy or severe sensitivity to milk run the risk of a serious or life-threatening allergic reaction if they consume the recalled product," the recall notice said.
Advertisement Advertisement Advertisement The recall is for the 13-ounce bag with a "Guaranteed Fresh" date of Feb. 11, 2025, and the manufacturing codes 6462307xx or 6463307xx.
No allergic reactions due to the milk issue were reported, and the company said none of its other chip flavors were affected, the notice said.
Consumers in the two states are encouraged to discard their bags and contact Frito-Lay Consumer Relations.
This article was originally published on NBCNews.com

author: La Nazione
title: Nuova antenna, scatta la petizione: "Il progetto deve essere annullato"
text:
I problemi legati alle concessioni di impianti per la telefonia mobile tornano in primo piano con una nuova segnalazione da parte del comitato Stop5GEmpoli-Valdelsa. "Durante lâ€™assemblea convocata dal sindaco a Cortenuova il 28 ottobre e con la risposta dellâ€™assessora allâ€™ambiente il 30 ottobre in consiglio comunale, abbiamo appreso una vicenda sorprendente. Unâ€™antenna di telefonia mobile, la cui richiesta era stata resa pubblica il 3 agosto e che non era prevista dal Piano delle antenne approvato dal consiglio comunale per aree pubbliche, ha ricevuto autorizzazione in tempi record. Appena un mese, in pieno agosto, su suolo pubblico". "Tutto questo â€“ sottolinea il Comitato â€“ Ã¨ successo senza averne discusso in Consiglio comunale. Questa autorizzazione Ã¨ stata concessa, a nostro avviso, contro ogni principio di trasparenza e correttezza istituzionale. Lâ€™antenna in questione sarÃ  collocata in via Bertolaccini, a Cortenuova".
Un passaggio che al Comitato e ai numerosi cittadini che lo compongono non Ã¨ piaciuto per niente. Al punto che hanno deciso di interrompere ogni rapporto con lâ€™amministrazione guidata da Alessio Mantellassi e di lanciare una petizione popolare volta a ottenere la revoca dellâ€™autorizzazione per lâ€™installazione dellâ€™antenna. "Noi, comitati di cittadini che da tempo ci opponiamo allâ€™espansione incontrollata delle compagnie telefoniche â€“ prosegue la nota del Comitato â€“ riteniamo sia giunto il momento di interrompere qualsiasi dialogo con lâ€™amministrazione comunale finchÃ© non sarÃ  annullato lâ€™atto unico del 6 settembre che consente alla compagnia di procedere con lâ€™installazione dellâ€™antenna. Abbiamo quindi ritenuto necessario avviare una petizione popolare di raccolta firme, ai sensi dellâ€™articolo 37 dello Statuto Comunale, chiedendo lâ€™annullamento dellâ€™autorizzazione. La petizione medesima Ã¨ stata presentata alla segreteria del Comune il 5 novembre e la raccolta firme continuerÃ  fino a gennaio 2025; nella prima settimana sono state raccolte oltre 400 firme".
"Ãˆ un processo paziente il nostro â€“ conclude il Comitato â€“ avviato a maggio scorso, che sta dando i suoi frutti, riscontrato anche nellâ€™attivitÃ  di volantinaggio nei mercati e nel centro cittadino e non solo, lâ€™aumento di consapevolezza e di sensibilitÃ  porta il singolo cittadino a cercarci come gruppo Stop5g attraverso i nostri contatti. Come Stop5GEmpoli-Valdelsa ribadiamo di mantenere sospese le nostre relazioni con lâ€™amministrazione comunale fino alla revoca dellâ€™autorizzazione concessa. Eâ€™ implicito che ogni cittadino puÃ² dialogare direttamente con lâ€™amministrazione comunale se ritiene di farlo. Stop5GEmpoli-Valdelsa invita i cittadini di Empoli a firmare la petizione alla postazione del banchino in via del Giglio, 2. Saremo presenti il 16 novembre, dalle 15 alle 20; il 23 novembre, dalle 10 alle 20 e sabato 30 novembre dalle 10 alle 20. La raccolta firme Ã¨ attiva dal 5 novembre 2024 al 3 gennaio 2025".

author: VNExplorer
title: Â¡La AEMET activa la alerta naranja de manera inesperada en varias zonas de EspaÃ±a por la DANA!
text:
A medida que nos acercamos al fin de semana, EspaÃ±a se encuentra en medio de una montaÃ±a rusa meteorolÃ³gica que ha mantenido a todos en vilo. La llegada de una DepresiÃ³n Aislada en Niveles Altos (DANA) ha desencadenado un cambio repentino en el clima, dando paso a lluvias intensas y tormentas en gran parte del paÃ­s.
MÃ¡s informaciÃ³n (Auto)
article
TÃ­tulo noticia (Auto)
99762643
Aunque las precipitaciones parecen estar disminuyendo gradualmente en la PenÃ­nsula, las islas Canarias se preparan para recibir los efectos de esta DANA en los prÃ³ximos dÃ­as.
Sin embargo, mientras la DANA se desplaza hacia el archipiÃ©lago canario, el sur de EspaÃ±a enfrenta otro desafÃ­o: alertas naranjas por el temporal marÃ­timo. La AEMET ha advertido sobre fuertes rÃ¡fagas de viento y olas impresionantes en el litoral de AlmerÃ­a y Granada, lo que podrÃ­a generar condiciones peligrosas para la navegaciÃ³n y la seguridad de los residentes.
A pesar de la aparente estabilizaciÃ³n del clima hacia el fin de semana, los pronÃ³sticos sugieren que la tranquilidad podrÃ­a ser efÃ­mera. Se espera que las temperaturas sufran un brusco descenso y que las precipitaciones, e incluso las nevadas, vuelvan a hacer su apariciÃ³n.
Con esta incertidumbre en el horizonte, la atenciÃ³n se centra en seguir de cerca las actualizaciones diarias para una mayor precisiÃ³n en las previsiones y una preparaciÃ³n adecuada ante cualquier eventualidad.

author: Remy Mastey
title: Filip Chytil Honest About Mental Hurdles He's Gone Through Over Recurring Injuries
text:
Filip Chytil Honest About Mental Hurdles Heâ€™s Gone Through Over Recurring Injuries
Itâ€™s been an up-and-down season for Filip Chytil. Heâ€™s played some of the best hockey of his career this season. However, Chytil canâ€™t seem to escape the injury demons. Chytil has missed nine games this season with two separate upper-body injuries. He recently was sidelined for three games before returning on Tuesday night against the Colorado Avalanche. The 25-year-old forward admitted he was not feeling like himself in his return, but was happy just to be back on the ice with his teammates. Itâ€™s been hard for Chytil to deal with all of these injuries from a mental standpoint, especiallyâ€¦

Un 17enne ÃƒÂ¨ stato accoltellato a Ravenna, in pieno centro storico. A colpirlo, secondo una prima ricostruzione, sarebbe stato un altro minorenne di origini tunisine, poi fuggito verso via Cavour. L'aggressore ÃƒÂ¨ stato rintracciato e bloccato dalla Polizia nei pressi di Porta Adriana. Sul posto sono intervenuti i sanitari del 118, che hanno trasportato il ferito in ospedale. Le sue condizioni non sono gravi. Anche l'autore dell'aggressione ÃƒÂ¨ stato accompagnato al pronto soccorso dopo aver accusato un malore.Ã‚ L'episodio ÃƒÂ¨ avvenuto ieri sera, martedÃƒÂ¬ 15 luglio, intorno alla mezzanotte. Il 17enne di origini tunisine ÃƒÂ¨ indagato per lesioni personali aggravate, detenzione di sostanze stupefacenti e di oggetti atti a offendere.

author: Kanwal Naz
title: AFROTC cade selected as first female cadet from UNL | News | dailynebraskan.com
text: Taylor Ziepke, a senior mathematics major, is the first woman to join the youngest branch of the U.S. Military, the Space Force, from the Air Force ROTC program. She is driven by her lifelong passion for space. Her inspiration behind wanting to be a part of the Space Force program stems from her childhood. â€œEver since I was little, I've wanted to be an astronaut. And then when I was a senior in high school, it was 2020, and the Space Force was made in 2019,â€ Ziepke said, â€œAnd I was kind of going back and forth if I wanted to do ROTC or not when I was a senior. Once I knew that the Space Force was being formed, â€¦ I felt like that was a sign because I was that kid that wanted to be an astronaut. And I was obsessed with space and was at the science fair and did all that stuff. And so that felt like a sign to me and like fate.â€ She went through the whole interview process last year in the spring and then found out the outcome of her selection in the Space Force last September. She said she is excited to set a foundation for future men and women that want to go to space, specifically through the Space Force. According to Ziepke, the Space Force stands as the youngest and smallest branch in the military with an estimated 16,000 personnel. This is relatively small, combined with a limited array of career fields which results in a highly selective recruitment process. â€œThere was an individual, Lieutenant Roush, (who was) commissioned in the Space Force when I was a freshman here. He was the first one to be commissioned in the Space Force from our ROTC detachment at Lincoln,â€ she said. â€œSo technically, I'm not only the second one to commission into the space force, but I'm (also) the first female from our program.â€ Ziepke said the Space Force program encompasses a wide range of operations beyond the traditional image of rockets and space exploration. It involves satellite operations, launches, debris tracking in space, cyber operations, engineering and various other components. The program is crucial for military operations across all branches, as satellites play a vital role in communication, navigation and surveillance. Being in its early stages since its establishment in 2019, the Space Force is continuously evolving, shaping its culture and refining its operational strategies. In discussing her future role, Ziepke said she will serve as a Space Operations Officer. Initially, she will undergo a comprehensive year-long training program covering various aspects of the position, such as space operations, cyber intelligence and acquisitions. She said she will oversee activities related to satellites and satellite command and control. This includes conducting space operations, leading subordinate personnel and managing satellite command functions. Ziepke highlighted the diverse areas within space operations, mentioning possibilities such as orbital warfare and electronic warfare. She said that while the specifics of her role will become clearer during training, the breadth of responsibilities is significant. Her training will encompass cyber acquisitions and space intelligence, adding to the multifaceted nature of her role. Ziepke explained her role and contribution to her current program. "In ROTC, it's this Reserve Officer Training. I'm (in) the Air Force Reserve Officer Training Corps," she said. "Right now, I'm a senior, and my position in the program is wing engagement officer. I help staff recruiting events for ROTC, like Red Letter Days and Husker Saturdays. I gather cadets to assist at our recruiting events. I'm currently planning a shadow day in March where we're inviting local high schoolers to join us for a day in the life of an ROTC cadet." Ziepke advises students to follow their passions, regardless of how small they are. â€œIf you have a dream in your heart, you were given that dream for a reason.It's up to you to chase it, and the sky is not the limit. You can do anything you set your mind to. I just want to be the best Space Force leader I can be and inspire those around me to chase their dreams, be the best leaders that they can be and work hard in everything they do,â€ Ziepke said.

author: financialcontent.com
title: The Michaels Organization Announces Electrical Vehicle Charging Program for Residents Across Its Military Housing Portfolio | FinancialContent Business Page
text:
Michaels and TRO Energy Solutions Partner Together to Deliver First In-Home Electric Vehicle Charging Stations at Joint Base Andrews and MacDill Air Force Base
CAMDEN, N.J. / ACCESSWIRE / February 15, 2024 / The Michaels Organization , a national leader in residential real estate that has been pioneering solutions to the nation's housing challenges for more than 50 years, has delivered the first electric charging stations to residents at two of its military housing communities - Joint Base Andrews in Maryland and MacDill Air Force Base in Florida.
Michaels, which currently owns and manages the privatized family housing at 11 military installations across the country, has committed to delivering such charging stations to its entire portfolio. Michaels currently owns and manages more than 18,000 privatized military homes from coast to coast, and has been a Department of Defense private sector partner since 2004.
The program is made possible through a partnership with Virginia-based TRO Energy Solutions, Inc. (TROES), a clean energy company that delivers turnkey solutions for the modernization and electrification of the transportation environment. The EV charging program for two communities in Michaels' military living portfolio - Liberty Park at Andrews and Harbor Bay at MacDill - had their first charger installations completed this month.
The Level 2 EV charging equipment installed, tested, and that will be maintained by TROES, is a response to resident requests, as well as Michaels' mission to invest in high-quality sustainability at all of its properties. Residents can use the chargers with ease through TROES' ChargeTime app.
"Michaels is delighted to partner with TROES to provide this incredible amenity for our military residents," said Quinlan Melvin, Director of Investment Management at The Michaels Organization. "This is a huge step forward for the electrification goals of the military that simultaneously supports Michaels' efforts in providing convenient and reliable housing for our nation's heroes."
The new EV charging stations at Andrews and MacDill represent the first in a series of efforts to promote cleaner and more cost-effective transportation solutions to every military installation in Michaels' portfolio.
"The TRO Energy Solutions Team is proud to support service members and their families at Joint Base Andrews and MacDill Air Force Base. Military members and their families make so many sacrifices as they serve our country. It is a privilege for us to work with military families to provide convenient and affordable in-home EV charging to keep their EVs powered up and ready to go when they are! We are pleased to partner with The Michaels Organization to bring this exciting amenity of Level 2 in-home EV charging to the housing communities of JB Andrews and MacDill AFB," said Edward DeVries, CEO of TRO Energy Solutions, Inc.
Ribbon-cutting ceremonies are planned for Feb. 26 at Harbor Bay at MacDill and at Liberty Park at Joint Base Andrews on March 21, 2024.
About The Michaels Organization
Michaels is a national leader in residential real estate, offering full-service capabilities in design, development, property management, construction, and investment management. Serving 200,000 residents in more than 570 communities across 39 states, the District of Columbia, and the U.S. Virgin Islands, Michaels is committed to crafting attainable housing solutions that jumpstart education, civic engagement and neighborhood prosperity, and to creating Communities That Lift Lives. Visit TMO.com our Media Room , and follow us on LinkedIn .
About TRO Energy Solutions, Inc.
TRO Energy Solutions, Inc. delivers clean-energy services and support in the promotion of an all-electric ecosystem. We pride ourselves in promoting electric vehicle (EV) usage, building renewable generation and storage infrastructure, and inspiring confidence in an electric ecosystem. The ChargeTime app with home charging products and economical services keep EV owners charged up and ready. Headquartered in Virginia Beach, VA, TROES is proud to support US military personnel with convenient in-home charging, community chargers, and dependable charging services.
Contact Information:
Laura Zaner
Vice President, Michaels Corporate Marketing
lzaner@tmo.com
856-988-5983; 856-630-1540
Terry Jacoby
Tro Energy Solutions
tjacoby@troenergy.io
757-325-9591
SOURCE: The Michaels Organization

author: Tyler Kuehl
title: Wild place Yakov Trenin on injured reserve with upper-body injury
text:
Wild place Yakov Trenin on injured reserve with upper-body injury
The [Minnesota Wild](/teams/minnesota-wild/line-combinations) made a couple of roster moves on Thursday.
The team placed forward Yakov Trenin on injured reserve with an upper-body injury. The Wild also assigned forward Devin Shore to their American Hockey League affiliate, the Iowa Wild.
The #mnwild has placed forward Yakov Trenin on Injured Reserve (upper body) and reassigned forward Devin Shore to the @IAWild.
December 19, 2024
Trenin had been listed as day-to-day with ailment, having missed the teamâ€™s last three games due to the injury. He was last in the lineup seven days ago when Minnesota fell to the Edmonton Oilers, 7-1. Since then, the Wild have fallen to the [Vegas Golden Knights](/teams/vegas-golden-knights/line-combinations) and [Florida Panthers](/teams/florida-panthers/line-combinations), though they beat the [Philadelphia Flyers](/teams/philadelphia-flyers/line-combinations) last Saturday.
Per the leagueâ€™s IR rules, Trenin could technically return to the lineup on Friday night when the Wild hosts the [Utah Hockey Club](/teams/utah-hockey-club/line-combinations), though there is no inclination that will come to fruition. Across the first five seasons of his NHL career, the Russian center has never played a full 82-game season. The closest Trenin came was in 2021-22 when he appeared in 80 games with the [Nashville Predators](/teams/nashville-predators/line-combinations).
Offensively, Trenin has been off to a slow start compared to the last couple of years. In 29 games, he has just two goals and an assist for three points, a little off the pace that led to him notching 17 points with the Predators and [Colorado Avalanche](/teams/colorado-avalanche/line-combinations) during the 2023-24 campaign.
The 27-year-old arrived in the Twin Cities this past summer after signing a [four-year contract](/news/wild-sign-yakov-trenin-to-four-year-3-5m-aav-contract), which carries an AAV of $3.5 million through the 2027-28 season.
Shore was placed on waivers on Tuesday and cleared on Wednesday. Per Michael Russo from The Athletic, with Trenin going on IR, there is a chance that Shore can be recalled to Minnesota to fill the roster spot.
The Wild (20-8-4) are second in the Central Division, three points behind the best team in the NHL, the [Winnipeg Jets](/teams/winnipeg-jets/line-combinations).

author: archyde
title: The United States sent seasonal flu data ahead of major vaccines.
text:
US Absence at WHO Influenza Vaccine Meeting Raises Concerns The World Health Organization (WHO) is scheduled too convene a crucial meeting next week in London to determine the composition of the upcoming influenza vaccine. A notable absence is causing concern among the global health community: the United States.
Dr. WenQing Zhang, Head of WHOâ€™s global influenza program, expressed concern over the USâ€™s lack of communication regarding flu activity within the country. â€œIt has not been reported on the WHO platform of Flunet and Fluid as January 20,â€ Zhang stated. These platforms are vital for global surveillance and informing vaccine development.
Why is US Participation Crucial? Accurate global influenza surveillance relies on data sharing. The United States, with its expansive geographic reach and diverse population, plays a pivotal role in understanding circulating flu strains.
â€œBecause the United States is geographically large, knowing any of the influenza strains makes a big difference,â€ emphasized Angela Rasmussen, a viral scientist and major research scientist of SASKATOONâ€™s Vaccine and Infectious Diseases Organization.
Dr. Keiji Fukuda, a doctor and epidemiologist who has worked for both the WHO and CDC, echoed this sentiment.â€The interpretation of the data is very vital,â€ he saeid.â€Discussing how your colleagues are looking at it, you can change the way you see it, and this kind of interaction is the way we create the most suitable formulation for the vaccine.â€
impact on Vaccine Development The US typically provides critical expertise and data on vaccine effectiveness to the WHO influenza vaccine meeting.Kanta Subbarao, Director of the WHO Collaborating Center of Influenza in Melbourne, Australia, highlighted this role. â€œThe CDC and FDA are actively involved in this process, so itâ€™s a bit difficult to guess what they are without them.â€ Subbarao noted that the absence of US participation could hinder the accurate prediction of which influenza strains will pose a threat in the Northern hemisphere.
Looking Ahead Despite the US absence, the WHO influenza vaccine meeting will proceed. However, experts emphasize the importance of US participation for complete and effective influenza surveillance and vaccine development. The global health community eagerly awaits the US decision and hopes for their continued engagement in ensuring a future with safer and more effective vaccines.
How can the global health community ensure an effective response too influenza in the upcoming season?
Special Interview: Exploring US Absence at WHO Influenza Vaccine Meeting Archyde News recently caught up with Dr. Maria Rodriguez , a renowned virologist and former advisor to the WHOâ€™s Influenza Vaccine Composition team, to discuss the impending WHO meeting and the significance of US participation.
Understanding the US Absence from the WHO Influenza Vaccine meeting Archyde: Dr. Rodriguez , the upcoming WHO meeting in London is set to determine the composition of the next influenza vaccine. However, the US will not be present. Can you shed some light on this notable absence?
Dr. Rodriguez: The US has historically been an integral part of these meetings, contributing crucial data and expertise. Sadly, it seems there has been a lack of communication regarding flu activity within the US, which is concerning for global surveillance and vaccine progress.
Why US Participation matters for global Influenza Surveillance Archyde: Why is the USâ€™s contribution so vital to global influenza surveillance?
Dr. Rodriguez: The US, with its vast geographic area and diverse population, can provide a wide range of data on circulating flu strains. This data is crucial for understanding how the virus behaves and evolves worldwide. Furthermore, the US typically shares valuable insights on vaccine effectiveness, enriching the global understanding of vaccine performance.
Impact on Influenza Vaccine Development Archyde: How does the USâ€™s absence impact the creation of the next influenza vaccine?
Dr. rodriguez: The USâ€™s role in predicting which influenza strains will pose a threat in the Northern hemisphere is notable. Without their input, the accuracy of these predictions could be compromised, potentially leading to a less effective vaccine. Additionally, the US provides valuable expertise in vaccine evaluation, which could be missed in their absence.
Looking Ahead: FBIâ€™s Decision and the Future of Influenza Vaccines Archyde: Despite the US absence, the meeting will proceed.How can other countries ensure an effective global response to influenza?
Dr. Rodriguez: Enhanced communication and data-sharing among countries are crucial.While the USâ€™s absence is significant, itâ€™s not insurmountable. Increased collaboration and information exchange can help bridge this gap and maintain global influenza surveillance.
Archyde: What action would you like to see from the US, and what message would you like to send to the global health community regarding the upcoming influenza season?
Dr. Rodriguez: I urge the US to reconsider their position and engage in the upcoming meeting.For the global community, I emphasize the importance of vigilance, data sharing, and collaboration. Weâ€™re all in this together,and our collective efforts can ensure a safer and more effective influenza vaccine for all.
Join the conversation! Share yoru thoughts on the US absence and its impact on global influenza surveillance.How can the global health community ensure an effective response to influenza in the upcoming season?
